body: For anyone reading: I'd appreciate tests on other OS's. That would help us determine where the problem might be.

I'm also encountering this exact same issue on Windows while updating from Bevy 0.14.2 to 0.15.3.  It looks like the problem was introduced in 8628545122782884596356fb3e9e0c1f8fce32fc.

Reverting  bevy_winit/src/state.rs back to Bevy 0.15.2 seems to fix the problem for me.

I'm unable to reproduce it on Windows 11 and I don't have a Windows 10 machine to test with. 

Right clicking the title bar is an issue with the way Windows integrates system menus and such. The window enters the "modal" loop when you right click which pauses the main event loop. The only way that I'm aware to correctly fix that is by putting the input processing in a different thread from the app simulation and rendering threads. Bevy's app simulation is strongly integrated into the input processing thread.

With that said, I don't think this issue is directly related to the right-click-title-bar problem. 

@zachbateman  Are you also on Windows 10 or can you reproduce on Windows 11?

Does changing the `WinitSettings`  `focused_mode` **and** `unfocused_mode` to `Continuous` have any effect?

https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/blob/3b24f520b9dc8fb8200d0982dcf6642311f715a4/crates/bevy_winit/src/winit_config.rs#L18-L23

@aloucks I'm using Windows 11.

Changing `WinitSettings` `focused_mode` and `unfocused_mode` to `UpdateMode::Continuous` via a `Startup` system does not seem to have any effect.

More specifically: I'm seeing the window freeze when dragging a file into the window for a drag-and-drop.  However, it looks like the window freezes as soon as the cursor enters the window with the drag, and remains frozen even if I do not drop the file in the application (take it back out).  As @jakemoran mentioned, resizing the window is the only way I have found to break the freeze.

Curiously, running an `Update` system continuously that just prints out the current `WinitSettings` seems to make this occur less frequently (occurs consistently while running the program, but sometimes doesn't occur on the next `cargo run`).  That combined with the overall intermittent behavior has me wondering if this may be due to a system/update ordering issue/ambiguity?

> That seems plausible, but I thought that bevy now printed warnings when system order was ambiguous unless you opted in to it (e.g. https://docs.rs/bevy/latest/bevy/prelude/trait.IntoScheduleConfigs.html#method.ambiguous_with)

We check this in CI for the main loop, but not the rendering loop currently.

@aloucks I thought the basic drag_and_drop example was working fine, but it will reproduce the problem for me also.  It seems to occur less frequently and may take a few drag-and-drops before it freezes, but it is consistently freezing for me on Windows 11.  Resizing the window breaks the freeze.
